nodes.text: Future Value of an Annuity
Now that we have derived a simple formula for the present value of an annuity, it is easy to find a simple formula for the future value. If we want to know the value
N
years in the future, we move the present value
N
periods forward on the timeline.
As the timeline shows, we compound the present value for
N
periods at interest rate
r
Future Value of an Annuity

nodes.text: This formula is useful if we want to know how a savings account will grow over time if the investor deposits the same amount every period.
Personal Finance: Example 4.5 Retirement Savings Plan Annuity
Problem

Ellen is 35 years old and she has decided it is time to plan seriously for her retirement. At the end of each year until she is 65, she will save $10,000 in a retirement account. If the account earns 10% per year, how much will Ellen have in her account at age 65?
Solution
Plan
As always, we begin with a timeline. In this case, it is helpful to keep track of both the dates and Ellen’s age:
Ellen’s savings plan looks like an annuity of $10,000 per year for 30 years. (
Hint
: It is easy to become confused when you just look at age, rather than at both dates and age. A common error is to think there are only
. Writing down both dates and age avoids this problem.)
To determine the amount Ellen will have in her account at age 65, we’ll need to compute the future value of this annuity.
Execute

data.alt: StartLayout 1st Row 1st Column upper F upper V 2nd Column equals 3rd Column Number dollar sign 1 0 comma 0 0 0 times StartFraction 1 Over 0.10 EndFraction left parenthesis 1.10 Superscript 30 Baseline minus 1 right parenthesis 2nd Row 1st Column Blank 2nd Column equals 3rd Column Number dollar sign 1 0 comma 0 0 0 times 164.49 3rd Row 1st Column Blank 2nd Column equals 3rd Column Number dollar sign 1 period 6 4 5 million at age 65 EndLayout

nodes.text: Using a financial calculator or Excel:
Evaluate
By investing $10,000 per year for 30 years (a total of $300,000) and earning interest on those investments, the compounding will allow Ellen to retire with $1.645 million.
Concept Check
What are some examples of annuities?
What is the difference between an annuity and a perpetuity?
